Class UserService

Api used to manage users and access tokens

  • Method Details

    • createAccessToken

      @RequestMapping(value="/api/access-token", method=POST) @ResponseBody @ResponseStatus(OK) public AccessToken createAccessToken(@RequestBody User user, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      creates a accesstoken to authenticate and authorize a user with
      Parameters:
      user - must include email and password. Everything else is not needed. TODO: Maybe make a class just for this?
      response - used to send back a cookie with the access token
      Returns:
      a access token the user can use to authenticate for using the api

    • generateAccessToken

      public AccessToken generateAccessToken()
      Generates and saves an accesstoken
      Returns:
      a new accesstoken that's saved in the database

    • retrieveAccessToken

      @RequestMapping(value="/api/access-token", method=GET) @ResponseStatus(OK) public AccessToken retrieveAccessToken(@CookieValue(name="access-token") AccessToken accessToken)
      Gets an access token from the database for checking the expiration date
      Parameters:
      accessToken - the access token to find
      Returns:
      the access token that was found

    • deleteAccessToken

      @RequestMapping(value="/api/access-token", method=DELETE) @ResponseStatus(OK) public void deleteAccessToken(@CookieValue(name="access-token") AccessToken accessToken, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)
      Deletes an access token from the database thus cutting authorization for the user
      Parameters:
      accessToken - the access token to delete
      response - used to update the users cookie with an expired one

    • postUser

      @RequestMapping(value="/api/user", method=POST) @ResponseBody @ResponseStatus(OK) public void postUser(@RequestBody User user) throws jakarta.mail.MessagingException
      Used to register a user to the service
      Parameters:
      user - must include email and password. Everything else is not needed. TODO: Maybe make a class just for this?
      Throws:
      jakarta.mail.MessagingException - thrown when the email address couldn't be delivered to
